Cup Jellies Now Illegal! (in the US and Canada)
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2002 Topics ( Year Of The Password): Cup Jellies Now Illegal! (in the US and Canada)
By Lisa Shock on Friday, October 18, 2002 - 10:44 pm:

Well, it looks like people ignored those warnings on cup jelly packages, and were giving them to kids, and not chewing them before swallowing. So, apparently they were the subject of a massive recall this summer. Too bad, really, I like them so much! More Info

Disclaimer: This site does not endorse the consumption of this horrifically dangerous product. If you choose to indulge, do so at your own risk!

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, October 26, 2002 - 02:06 pm:

Um, 15 deaths world-wide is a very, very small number. About 10 deaths occur each year in the US alone from children choking on balloons. Yet, every Toys R Us, party shop, discount store, etc. carry them, and people continue to buy them. Most incidences of children choking are cause by food. However, remember that we are talking about a product that is clearly labelled as dangerous to children, but those parents fed them to kids anyway.

The fact is, the people making cup jellies don't have powerful lobbyists to help themselves get the sorts of exemptions that other manufacturers routinely get. The number #1 toy that kids choke on, and has been for over a decade, is Micro Machines. But, they are allowed to simply point at their warning label and walk away, because they lobby the legislatures.

Also, geletain is not an acceptable substitute. It is manufactured with beef and pork, and in many cases is not kosher, and may have a danger of spreading mad cow disease. Not, to mention that simply by not being vegetarian, it is undesirable by a large segment of the world's population.
